posts.name: ahuang
posts.cooked:
We have upgraded robotpy and everything attached to the 2025 versions, yet when we try to run   py -3 -m robotpy sync, we get No module named robotpy.  Yet we have robotpy when we do pip list, which is really weird. Additionally when we try any command with robotpy-installer, we get the same error, No module named robotpy-installer, yet when we do pip list, we see that we indeed have robotpy-installer

Here is all the versions and packages we have:

bcrypt                   4.2.1 cffi                     1.17.1 click                    8.1.8 colorama                 0.4.6 cryptography             44.0.0 flexcache                0.3 flexparser               0.4 iniconfig                2.0.0 msvc_runtime             14.42.34433 numpy                    2.2.1 packaging                23.2 paramiko                 3.5.0 phoenix6                 25.1.0 Pint                     0.24.4 pip                      24.3.1 platformdirs             4.3.6 pluggy                   1.5.0 pycparser                2.22 pyfrc                    2025.0.0 PyNaCl                   1.5.0 pynetconsole             2.0.4 pyntcore                 2025.2.1 pytest                   8.3.4 pytest-reraise           2.1.2 robotpy                  2025.2.1.0 robotpy-apriltag         2025.2.1 robotpy-cli              2024.0.0 robotpy-commands-v2      2025.1.1 robotpy-cscore           2025.2.1 robotpy-ctre             2025.0.0 robotpy-hal              2025.2.1 robotpy-halsim-ds-socket 2025.2.1 robotpy-halsim-gui       2025.2.1 robotpy-halsim-ws        2025.2.1 robotpy-installer        2025.0.0 robotpy-navx             2025.0.1 robotpy-pathplannerlib   2025.2.1.post1 robotpy-rev              2025.0.1 robotpy-romi             2025.2.1 robotpy-wpilib-utilities 2025.0.0 robotpy-wpimath          2025.2.1 robotpy-wpinet           2025.2.1 robotpy-wpiutil          2025.2.1 robotpy-xrp              2025.2.1 schedule                 1.2.2 setuptools               75.8.0 tomli                    2.2.1 tomlkit                  0.13.2 typing_extensions        4.12.2 wpilib                   2025.2.1

How do we resolve this issue?
Did you run pip list or py -3 -m pip list ?

posts.name: ahuang
posts.cooked: we ran pip list and pip3 list. Running py -3 -m pip list gives us nothing. We have everything on a virtual environment

So you have 2 different pythons.

Use py -3 -m pip to install robotpy

posts.name: ahuang
posts.cooked: Is there anyway to run it in the virtual environment or do we have to install everything without the virtual environment?

posts.name: Davo
posts.cooked: I would definitely recommend using a virtual environment. If you’re having trouble using a venv, it sounds like you forgot to activate it?

posts.name: ahuang
posts.cooked: How to we activate a venv?

link_counts.title: Install packages in a virtual environment using pip and venv - Python Packaging User Guide

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
Using a virtualenv is fine, and not using a virtualenv is fine – but don’t mix them. If you install things in one, make sure they’re not installed in the other, or subtle bugs or confusion sometimes can occur. If you want to use a virtualenv, then see the documentation link posted above.

My opinion: I’ve never told my students to use a virtualenv, they only use the system installation. Virtualenv is great for advanced python users, but it’s just extra red tape if you’re only working on a single python project.

posts.name: ahuang
posts.cooked: I see. We are trying out the virtualenv this year, since one of our mentors suggested it, but I will keep that in mind Thank you so much!
